"Softcorp Industries"

Welcome

Welcome to my "Home Work" web site, the second of three web sites that I'm building on my path to becoming a Front-End Web Developer.

Get with "The Program"

Learn to "Code"

Anyone who has gone down the Self-Taught route knows you build a lot of projects on that path. After awhile I started making my own templates for my projects with a <header> & <footer> for myself. I then put whatever project I'm working on in the <main> tag.

The next challenge I gave myself was to create the templates using the DOM. So now my project templates were being created using the DOM and not hard coded into the HTML.

In the end I ended up with a lot of different little projects. The next challenge was to make an environment to display all of my projects on one Web Site. So I created the "Home Work" web site to display the small projects and skills that I'm learning.

I divided the page into chapters that contain similar concepts, they also have different experience levels and skills included.

I hope you enjoy and find something that interests you. This site is part of my learning experience and I do not use it for profit.

Buttons

The <button> tag is the most basic element used to create a clickable button. We can also create a clickable button with almost any element using a little bit of javaScript. The <input> and <div> tags are very common elements to create clickable buttons as well.

These projects show the different elements that can be used to create a button. I also incorporated some javaScript local storage and @keyframes for the animation.

<button>

Synopsis:

I created 5 <button> elements that changes the theme color on all the project boxes. The button's use local storage to save the theme color and the button's position, I added a conditional so that only one toggle is active at any one time.

Design by: Softcorp Industries
